choices.a: The typeof is a unary operator that is placed before its single operand, which can be of any type.

What purpose does alt serve in an image tag?

choices.a: Provide visually impaired users with descriptive text of an image.
choices.b: If an image link is broken, this text can replace the image
choices.c: alt tags can be useful for users who browse with images turned off.

question: What does the JavaScript function getElementsByClassName(<classname>) return?

choices.b: A collection of HTML objects, or nodes in a list structure that can be iterated.
choices.c: The first element that it finds in the HTML document.
choices.d: All classes in the document by <classname>

question: What does the term 'bootstrap' refer to?

choices.a: A javascript file linked into the <head> with a <script> tag.
choices.b: Any css file stylesheet placed in the HTML.
choices.c: A phrase that means using an outside sources css file to style your HTML.
choices.d: A popular front-end framework that can be used for styling, user-interface, and much more.

question: What does the term 'Vanilla JavaScript' refer to?

choices.a: Vanilla JavaScript is referring to raw/plain JavaScript. Frameworks are built with Vanilla JavaScript.
choices.b: A framework of JavaScript that focuses on condensed library code.
choices.c: A play on words to convince companies that raw/plain JavaScript was a new and great framework.
choices.d: A Ben and Jerry's ice cream flavor that leaves your tummy feeling undefined.

question: Why is the 'lang' attribute necessary?

choices.b: This is used to signal to screen readers what language the content of the page is written in.

question: In window.localStorage(<item>), what is the acceptable data type for <item>?

choices.a: the item can be any data type.
choices.b: the item can only be integers.
choices.c: the item has to be alphanumeric only.
choices.d: the item can only be a string type.
